title: Leipzig
summary: Leipzig (/ˈlaɪpsɪɡ, ˈlaɪp(t)sɪx/,[4][5][6] German: [ˈlaɪptsɪç] (listen); Upper Saxon: Leibz'sch) is the most populous city in the German state of Saxony. With a population of 605,407 inhabitants as of 2021[7][8] (1.1 million[9] residents in the larger urban zone),[3] it is Germany's eighth most populous city[10][11] as well as the second most populous city in the area of former East Germany after (East) Berlin. Together with Halle (Saale), the largest city of the neighbouring state of Saxony-Anhalt, the city forms the polycentric conurbation of Leipzig-Halle. Between the two cities (in Schkeuditz) lies Leipzig/Halle Airport.
